intro: Elymus tschimganicus, commonly known as the Tschimgan grass, is a perennial grass species native to Central Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and dense, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as steppes and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and坚韧, adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Elymus tschimganicus plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for grazing animals in its native range.
